intro: Cardiospermum coluteoides, commonly known as the velvetleaf or heartleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, angular seeds. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil types make it both ecologically significant and sometimes invasive.
